greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: XOR difference triangle of the odd numbers, read by rows.
comment: Main diagonal is A099890, the XOR BINOMIAL transform of the odd numbers. See A099884 for the definitions of the XOR BINOMIAL transform and the XOR difference triangle.
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8000
formula: T(n, k) = SumXOR_{i=0..k} (C(k, i)mod 2)*(2*(n-i)+1), where SumXOR is the analog of summation under the binary XOR operation and C(k, i)mod 2 = A047999(k, i). T(2^n, 2^n) = 2^(n+1) for n>=0, with T(0, 0)=1.
mathematica: mx = 14; Flatten@Table[NestList[BitXor @@@ Transpose[{Most@#, Rest@#}] &, Range[1, 2 mx, 2], mx][[k, n - k]], {n, 2, mx}, {k, n - 1}] (* _Ivan Neretin_, Sep 01 2016 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 29 2004
